name: ladyfinger
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type of biscuit or cake with a long, thin shape and rounded ends, that is soft inside and hard outside and covered with sugar. Lady fingers are often used for making desserts (= sweet dishes eaten at the end of a meal): Dip the remaining ladyfingers into the espresso and use them to cover the cream mixture. Line the bottom and sides of the springform pan with lady fingers.
More examplesFewer examplesLayer the ladyfingers with the custard.A charlotte is made by lining a dish with sponge cake or ladyfingers and filling it with fruit, whipped cream, or custard.The mold is lined with cake or lady fingers before being filled with the cream mixture.Cover the cream mixture with another layer of coffee-soaked lady fingers.
